name: Grupo Aeroportuario del Centro Norte, S.A.B. de C.V.
description: Grupo Aeroportuario del Centro Norte, commonly known as OMA, is a leading airport operator in Mexico, managing 13 airports in the central and northern regions of the country. Established in 1998, OMA plays a crucial role in the Mexican aviation industry, providing essential infrastructure and services to facilitate air travel. The company is dedicated to enhancing the passenger experience through continuous improvements in airport facilities and services while adhering to high safety and security standards. OMA's airports include key locations such as Monterrey, Acapulco, and Chihuahua, serving millions of passengers annually. The company also focuses on environmental sustainability and community engagement, implementing initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint and supporting local development. OMA is publicly traded on the Mexican Stock Exchange and has attracted significant investment due to its strategic importance in the growing aviation market in Mexico. With a commitment to operational excellence and customer satisfaction, OMA continues to expand its services and improve its airports to accommodate increasing passenger and cargo traffic.

faq.answer: OMA operates and manages 13 airports in central and northern Mexico, providing passenger and cargo services.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of OMA?
faq.answer: Jorge Luis de la Vega is the CEO of Grupo Aeroportuario del Centro Norte.

faq.question: Where is OMA headquartered?
faq.answer: OMA is headquartered in Monterrey, Nuevo León, Mexico.
